intro: Canariopsis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf canarybush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Canariopsis angustifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes.
